text: Peru competed at the 1964 Summer Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. 31 competitors, 30 men and 1 woman, took part in 19 events in 5 sports. 15 year-old, Rosario de Vivanco was the first female athlete to represent Peru at the Olympic Games. ==Athletics== ;Track events {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" !rowspan="2"|Athletes !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Quarterfinal !colspan="2"|Semifinal !Final !rowspan="2"|Rank |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result |- |rowspan=2|Gerardo di Tolla |Men's 100 metres |align=center|10.9 |align=center|7 |align=center colspan=6|Did not advance |- |Men's 200 metres |align=center|22.1 |align=center|7 |align=center colspan=6|Did not advance |- |José Cavero |400 metres Hurdles |align=center|53.7 |align=center|6 |align=center colspan=2|Did not advance |colspan=2 |align=center colspan=2|Did not advance |} ;Field events {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan=2|Athlete !rowspan=2|Event !colspan=2|Qualification !colspan=2|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Roberto Abugattas |rowspan=3|High jump |align=center|1.95 |align=center|26 |align=center colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==Basketball== Peru won two of its games to finish seventh in its group. It lost to Canada by one point in the knock-out stage but won its final matches against Korea to claim the 14th place. ===Group B=== {| class="infobox bordered" |- |width=10px bgcolor="#ccffcc"| ||Qualified for the semifinals |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !width=170|Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=30| !width=30| !width=30| !width=20| !width=60| |-bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| || 7 || 0 || 569 || 333 || +236 || 14 || |-bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| || 5 || 2 || 473 || 452 || +21 || 12 || 1W−0L |- |align=left| || 5 || 2 || 529 || 453 || +76 || 12 || 0W−1L |- |align=left| || 4 || 3 || 472 || 482 || −10 || 11 || |- |align=left| || 3 || 4 || 409 || 475 || −66 || 10 || |- |align=left| || 2 || 5 || 434 || 460 || −26 || 9 || 1W−0L |- |align=left| || 2 || 5 || 431 || 453 || −22 || 9 || 0W−1L |- |align=left| || 0 || 7 || 432 || 641 || −209 || 7 || |} ===Knockout Stage=== ;13th-16th ===Squad=== *Carlos Vásquez *Enrique Duarte *Jorge Vargas *José Guzmán *Luis Duarte *Manuel Valerio *Oscar Benalcázar *Oscar Sevilla *Raúl Duarte *Ricardo Duarte *Simon Peredes *Tomás Sangio |} ==Cycling== === Road=== {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !Rider !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Teófilo Toda |align=left|Road race |colspan=2|DNF |} ==Shooting== Nine shooters represented Peru in 1964.
